instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message:
Please help, Client said he shutdown night before, the next morning, the system refused to power on. Have tried all key sequences from SMC to NVRAM, no power still.

here is what I found on the Logic board.
[ATTACH type="full"]59374[/ATTACH]

After cleaning with isopropyl, I arrive at this:
[ATTACH type="full"]59376[/ATTACH]

After reading arrowed components I got 0V, but with a working logic board I got 5.1V
Apologies to my word arrangement.

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Marked component is L4010.
You can replace it with a tiny wire.
However, needs to have 5V on its pad 1; check that.
And be sure no short to ground at pad 2; w/ and w/o webcam connected.

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 63805, member: 682"]
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Marked component is L4010.
You can replace it with a tiny wire.
However, needs to have 5V on its pad 1; check that.
And be sure no short to ground at pad 2; w/ and w/o webcam connected.
[/QUOTE]
Unfortunately,  L4010 pad 1 and pad 2 read 0V
L4013 pad 1 reads 0V
L4011 pad 2 reads 0V, pad 1 reads 5.1V

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message:
[QUOTE="omiran, post: 63808, member: 27056"]
Unfortunately,  L4010 pad 1 and pad 2 read 0V
L4013 pad 1 reads 0V
L4011 pad 2 reads 0V, pad 1 reads 5.1V
[/QUOTE]
I'm here with a positive mindset that I will get this logic board fixed. Please help

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message:
Ooops, I just realized your machine doesn't power at all.
I was thinking board works, but no webcam; as you specified that voltage missing.
You are missing lot of voltages probably, but didn't post accurate info...

"L4011 pad 2 reads 0V, [U]pad 1 reads 5.1V[/U]"
Means 5V_S3 is present.

"L4010 [U]pad 1[/U] and pad 2 [U]read 0V"[/U]
Means no 5V_S0 present.

Post exact voltage on PPBUS_G3H (charger only) and the big coils from the board.

Please do not use "Reply" button.
Just write in the reply box; no need to quote an entire post visible few centimeters above...
[U][/U]

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H  reads 12.56V.
PP5V_S3 is present
PP5V_S0 not present.

could this break have an effect on the coil?

[ATTACH type="full" alt="coil1.jpeg"]59378[/ATTACH]

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message:
Likely not if the core is good.

"PP5V_S3 is present
PP5V_S0 not present."
I already knew that, above mentioned; expected to get other information.

"Post exact voltage on ... the big coils from the board"
???

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message:
Apologies for the delay in response, was at the wheel.

below are the readings for both big and small coil.
[LIST]
[*]L3095 - 0V
[*]L7130 - 12.54V
[*]L7195 - 5.48V
[*]L7560 - 3.32V
[*]L7710 - 0V
[*]L7720 - 0V
[*]L7430 - 1.17V
[*]L7820 - 1.76V
[*]L8300 - 0V
[*]L7320 - 0V
[*]L7310 - 0V
[*]L7630 - 0V
[/LIST]
Big thanks for your help so far

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message:
I bet you have 5V at L7520; do NOT forget it next time.

Post PM_SLP_S3_L signal voltage.

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message:
Noted Boss.

I will do that as soon as possible in the morning. It’s 10:43pm GMT. 

Have a good one.

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message:
L7520 you're right.
PM_SLP_S3_L reads 3.32V

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message:
Is that steady voltage?
No higher pulse in the first second?

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message:
there was. about 5.8V max.
Ranges from 2.02V to 5.8V before it now settled at 3.32V

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message:
Then you must get all S0 voltages, check that now.
ALL_SYS_PWRGD goes high?

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message:
ALL_SYS_PWRGD reads 0V
S0 reads. 

please what next?

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message:
"S0 reads."
What this mean???

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message: S0 reads 0V I meant

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message:
So you don't get any S0 voltage???
It should, if PM_SLP_S3_L stays high...

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message:
Unfortunately no, PM_SLP_S3_L on R8178 pin 2 reads 3.32V
PP5V_S0 reads 0V

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message:
have worked around the board and I noticed that P5VS0_EN is 0V. C8187 pin 1 to P5VS0_EN reads 0V. R8187 pin2 also reads 0V. U8080 pin 2 also reads 0V.

U8180 is the water affected area with its pin 4 reading 0V. R8167 pin 2 reading 0V.

I'm confused here identifying which logic gate between U8080 and U8180 receives the P5VS0_EN first before I change the wrong logic gate?

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message: What about PM_SLP_S3_BUF_L?

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message: PM_SLP_S3_BUF_L is 0V

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message:
Hello Dear friend,

I'm skeptical about replacing the suspected chip (U8180). Considering a basic note on Rossman's Training guide that pointed not to replace IC that does not have voltage at an"Enable" pin,  the pin may have not been told to come on. If yes can you please identify chip responsible to turn on the missing pin (P5VS0_EN) at U8180.

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message:
How do you think U8180 works???

[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.google.com/search?client=firefox-b-d&bih=866&biw=1680&hl=es&sxsrf=ALeKk01eo3Ijf39kkt0W8CvTzkGfhGGpAQ%3A1598089407777&ei=v-hAX5znLreIjLsPxsaIgAc&q=2+input+and+gate&oq=2+input+and+gate&gs_lcp=CgZwc3ktYWIQAzIGCCMQJxATMgQIABATMgQIABATMgQIABATMgQIABATMgQIABATMgQIABATMgQIABATMgQIABATMgQIABATOgQIABBHUMalA1jGpQNgxbQDaABwAXgAgAFziAFzkgEDMC4xmAEAoAEBqgEHZ3dzLXdpesABAQ&sclient=psy-ab&ved=0ahUKEwjcwuD7wq7rAhU3BGMBHUYjAnAQ4dUDCAs&uact=5[/URL]

Be sure to have power at pin 5 first...

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message:
"PM_SLP_S3_BUF_L still 0V"
Post diode mode there.

If pins 1, 2 & 5 are high, then pin 4 must be high too; already passed links about how such chip works.

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message: pin 1 and 2 reads 1.21, pin 5 reads 3.32 but pin 4 reads 0V... Does it mean that my case is a rare one?

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message:
"PM_SLP_S3_L reads 3.32V
-----------
pin 1 and 2 reads 1.21"
Check R8178...

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message: R8178 reads 3.32V. i'm surprised why I get 3.32V on R8178 and PM_SLP_S3_L pin 1 and 2 will read 1.21V. What's missing here?

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message:
Looks like U8180 has some internal problem, change it.
Be sure first, R8178 has correct 100 ohm value.

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message: Just curious. "PM_SLP_S3_BUF_L” produces  P5VS0_EN right?

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message: It is splited in various enable signals, as per schematic...

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message: Oh thanks. I just noticed that every Components on PM_SLP_S3_BUF_L power line are givBig 0V but components before PM_SLP_S3_BUF_L Read their actual Volts. Just trying to get a better understanding of the messages diff  schematics are trying to pass

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message: R8178 reads 99.7ohms

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message: Did you change U8180???

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message: Yes I did. But no 0V at PM_SLP_S3_BUF_L still

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message:
I tried to explain you several times; the output depends of input states.
Did you read something from the Google results???
Do you have 3V at both pins 1 & 2?

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message: No!i have 1.21V on pin 1 and 2. Only pin 5 reads 3V

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message: Post voltage on both pins of R8178.

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message: R8178. reads 3.32V

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message:
On both pins?
How don't you have 3V at U8180 input pins then???

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message: On U8180:  Pin 1 and  2 read 1.21V, Pin 3 is GND, Pin 4 the troublesome guy reads 0V and Pin 5 reads 3V.

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message:
At PM_SLP_S3_R_L are only U8180 and Q8131connected.
If you have 1.2V there and 3.3V at PM_SLP_S3_L, guess what???
Bad U8180, or R8178; less probably bad Q8131...

threads.title: 820-4924 no power, PP5V_S3RS0_ALSCAM_F missing
threads.message: Great! Have changed U8180 though, but I guess must be a bad one still. I will try another U8180 tomorrow and give you feed back on it... have a good one champ.
